question: What is an NFT?
answer: NFT stands for non-fungible token. That may sound like an intimidating technical term, but NFTs are just digital certificates of authenticity that prove ownership of a unique digital asset like art, music, collectibles, videos or anything else with blockchain technology.

question: What is a wallet?
answer: A crypto wallet is a software on a blockchain (such as Cardano) that stores your cryptocurrency, private keys and other crypto assetsâ€”including NFTs. A crypto wallet lets you create on-chain transactions, sign transactions, add funds to your wallet and sell or buy NFTs. Your crypto wallet is your gateway to Web3 because it lets you connect to a decentralized application (dApp) like Crashr. An example of a crypto wallet is Nami.

question: Which Cardano wallets can I use?
answer: Nami, Eternal, Flint, Yoroi, Begin, Typhon, Gero, Nufi can be connected and used on Crashr. More wallets will be implemented in the future.

question: How do I create a Cardano wallet?
answer: A user-friendly wallet to create on a desktop for beginners is Nami wallet. https: //namiwallet.io/

question: What currencies does CRASHR use?
answer: The main currency of Crashr is ADA. We will be implementing the use of Cardano native tokens in the near future.

question: Is there any collateral?
answer: No, there is 0 collateral as our smart contracts are plutus v2.

question: Can anyone start a raffle?
answer: Yes, any user on our platform has access to use our raffle system to auction off their assets.

question: If I start a raffle can I cancel it?
answer: If your Raffle does not hit the minimum amount you chose, you can decide to refund all users and cancel. If your raffle is/above the minimum amount of tickets, you will not be able to cancel.

question: Will I be able to use cardano native tokens for raffles?
answer: Yes, you will be able to choose which Tokens and the amount you will like to raffle out your asset with.

question: Can anyone use the voting system?
answer: Yes, anyone can use the voting system and create polls for any topics in the space.

question: How many voting proposals am I allowed to do?
answer: You are allowed to create unlimited voting proposals!

question: How do you vote on a proposal?
answer: You vote on a proposal by using the token currency selected for the proposal 1 Token = 1 Vote. Once you vote, your token/tokens will be locked up for the remainder of the proposal then refunded back when the proposal ends.
